channel.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
channel.description:
[size=20pt]MY IPOD FROZE AND I CANNOT LIVE ANY FUCKING LOOOONGER WITHOUT IT!!1!!!!1!!!!11!!!1!1!111[/size]
HELP ME FIX IT PLEAASSSEEEEEEEEE, ITS TURNED ON BUT WON'T DO NOTHIN!!1!!!!1!!!!!1!!

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:180931”]And how would you download this music?

I’m guessing P2P sharing…

Did you see the bit about “sharing”?

[retard]Thats right… When you download music, you share it at the same time. [/retard][/quote]

Or…you could just select do not share (input music folder name)

Seriously whos pays for music?

Next your going to be telling me you pay for things like photoshop and cable…heh

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @x0_0wn x0 0wn
item.description:
@x0_0wn wrote:

It happened to me, I plugged it into the PC and it worked again…

Happened again, reset it…

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

On another topic

It is in the terms and conditions on the BT website that people using P2P sharing applications will have their bandwidth reduced because it is not fair on other people

It’s your ISP then. Virgin media had a brief period where if you download x mb during peak hours(2 pm to 11pm or something) then your speed you get will be half of what your paying for, and this will last 4 hours, but they seem to have remove it(ie, no limitations).

Tiscali, on the other hand, just can’t provide the bandwidth you request so your stuck with 1mb regardless of line conditions or the package your paying for.

Read full topic

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @0wn3d_n00b Ooo Java
item.description:
@0wn3d_n00b wrote:

Press the center button and Menu - It will turn off then the apple logo SHOULD show, if not, Haha

Read full topic

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Martin, post:22, topic:179087”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=240206.msg2049538#msg2049538 date=1202865829]

Well i saw on the news today that here in the uk the government are trying to get ISPs to scan downloads to check for downloading of copyrighted films and music.

And i saw in the newspaper today that ISPs will cut out the internet service provided to people downloading music.
[/quote]

That won’t happen. Newspapers talk shit more than half the time.[/quote]

In this case, the media did not invent it, it is being talked about. If it goes through, ISPs would have to cut the service of illegal downloaders after 3 warnings or face massive fines.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 14, 2008, 03:13:17 PM[/size][hr][quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:180958”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=240206.msg2049522#msg2049522 date=1202865592]
Well i saw on the news today that here in the uk the government are trying to get ISPs to scan downloads to check for downloading of copyrighted films and music.
[/quote]
And i saw in the newspaper today that ISPs will cut out the internet service provided to people downloading music. It uses up too much bandwidth and thats why i get 1Mb instead of the promised 8Mb.[/quote]

That’s not true. The reason you don’t get 8mb (which, by the way, is not promised and never will be) is a combination of physical limitations (ie distance from the exchange, quality of wiring in your area) and oversold bandwidth.

Read full topic

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:180931”][quote author=Niall link=topic=240206.msg2049312#msg2049312 date=1202856502]
I like your whole argument of buying songs is the way to go, magma828. Would you prefer us to PAY for music, only to find out we cannot play it on an mp3 player of our choice? Or that certain restrictions come with the product we chose to pay for, when it’s entirely legal to download it for free? Yes, if I remember correctly, it is only illegal to upload/share music, and even if downloading music was illegal, it would be completely illogical to arrest 100,000 people that download music, when say, 1,000 people that share it, would knock out a large part of torrenting if they got arrested.
[/quote]

[retard]Thats right… When you download music, you share it at the same time. [/retard][/quote]

I take it your not computer illiterate?

No program can FORCE you to upload, if you cannot disable it, you can find another program to stop uploading completely.

Really though, if your so paranoid about downloading/uploading, what makes you think that you will be arrested for uploading say, 50mb~ a day when people with fast lines and massive music collections seed 24/7?

Read full topic

item.title: My iPod FROZE!1!111!
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

Niall:

I like your whole argument of buying songs is the way to go, magma828. Would you prefer us to PAY for music, only to find out we cannot play it on an mp3 player of our choice? Or that certain restrictions come with the product we chose to pay for, when it’s entirely legal to download it for free? Yes, if I remember correctly, it is only illegal to upload/share music, and even if downloading music was illegal, it would be completely illogical to arrest 100,000 people that download music, when say, 1,000 people that share it, would knock out a large part of torrenting if they got arrested.

i get all my music from limewire and it seems to work on my ipod so who cares?

Read full topic
